header.abstract: The Gina Webb papers (dated 1992-1999, undated; 0.45 cubic feet; 1 box) comprise transcripts, historical notes, letters, and some photographs and negatives gather by Webb for an oral history project with residents of Perryville, Kentucky.

descriptive_summary.author: Ida Lucille Mangum
descriptive_summary.title: Gina Webb papers
descriptive_summary.arrangement: Collection is arranged into two series by format.
descriptive_summary.prefercite: 2021ms088: [identification of item], Gina Webb papers, 1992-1999, undated, University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Gina Webb is a historian living in Boyle County, Kentucky. During the 1990's she conducted oral history interviews with residents of Perryville, Kentucky about local history.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Gina Webb papers (dated 1992-1999, undated; 0.45 cubic feet; 1 box) comprise transcripts, historical notes, letters, and some photographs and negatives gather by Webb for an oral history project with residents of Perryville, Kentucky. The transcripts cover the town, the people, the culture, the commerce. Of significance, the collection includes interviews and photographs related to slavery, and the post-Civil War settlement in Boyle County of former enslaved persons called Sleettown.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The physical rights to the materials in this collection are held by the University of Kentucky Special Collections Research Center.
